description:
Back on Sonic's home planet, Eggman has collected all 7 of the Chaos Emeralds, and is about to have absolute power when Sonic interferes, causing an explosion that sends everyone from their world to Earth. Sonic and his friends team up with 12 year old Christopher Thorndyke to collect all the Chaos Emeralds and defeat the evil Dr. Eggman.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Butler
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a butler.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Primarily Animal Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed animal or animal-like characters.

node.description:
[Website](http://www.ike-yoshihiro.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ikeyoshihiro)

Yoshihiro Ike is a Japanese composer, music arranger, and bassist. He is best known for scoring and composing music for movies, TV dramas, Anime and video games and has worked on more than 100 titles in the last 20 years.

His debut anime title, [Blood: The Last Vampire](https://anilist.co/anime/405/), was nominated for the 2000 UK Music Awards under the soundtrack category, and subsequently awarded the top prize at the Japan Media Arts Festival in 2001 by the Agency for Cultural affairs. In 2006, his score for [Kamichu!](https://anilist.co/anime/489/) received an Excellence Prize at the 2005 Japan Media Arts Festival. In 2018, Shadowverse original soundtracks became the highest-ranking album on iTunes, surpassing Shallow by Lady Gaga.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/谷口守泰)

A veteran animator with a career spanning nearly 60 years.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [scriptwriter](https://anilist.co/staff/119169/)._

He started working at Studio Z. Later he started together with Hideyuki Motohashi and Hajime Kamegaki's Studio Z5 but left already shortly after working on God Mars. Today he is affiliated with TMS Entertainment

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/西見祥示郎)

In 1986, Nishimi joined [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/), where he worked until going freelance in 2003. Since then he has participated on numerous of [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/)'s projects. His illustrations as an amateur became a topic of conversation among creators such as [Kouji Morimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100066/), one of the founders of Studio 4°C.

He started working at Studio Z. Later he started together with Hideyuki Motohashi and Hajime Kamegaki's Studio Z5 but left already shortly after working on God Mars. Today he is affiliated with TMS Entertainment

Yokota Kazuyoshi was a storyboarder and director working for Nippon Animation. He was best known for his involvement with the World Masterpiece Theater series and as the director of Uchuusen Sagittarius. His debut as series director was Miimu Iro Iro Yume no Tabi.
